|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | 1. **Simplicity and readability:** A lambda function can be written in a single line of code. Therefore, it's often more readable and concise. This is particularly useful for simple operations that can be performed in a single expression.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | 2. **No need for a function name:** Lambda functions are anonymous, meaning they don't need a name. This makes them easy to use when you need a function for a short period of time, particularly as arguments to higher-order functions that take other functions as inputs.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | 3. **Use inside other functions:** Lambda functions can be used within other functions, allowing for functional programming constructs like closures.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | However, aggregate functions in Python (like `sum()`, `max()`, etc.) are built-in functions that operate on lists or other iterables, and provide a single result. They don't replace lambda functions but are often used in conjunction with them.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | For example, consider you have a list of dictionaries and you want to find the dictionary that has the maximum value for a certain key. You could use the `max()` function with a lambda function to do this:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | ```python                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | data = [{'name': 'John', 'score': 10}, {'name': 'Jane', 'score': 12}, {'name': 'Doe', 'score': 8}]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | highest_score = max(data, key=lambda x: x['score'])                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | print(highest_score)  # Output: {'name': 'Jane', 'score': 12}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | ```                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | As such, there isn't really a speed difference between using a lambda function and using a regular function. |      |                                      |               |               | But keep in mind that lambda functions are limited because they can only contain an expression and cannot include statements, which may limit what you can do within a lambda function. |      |                                      |               |               | 1. **Register an Azure AD app to use with Power BI**: The first step is to register an application within the Azure portal to use with Power BI. |      |                                      |               |               | 1. |      |                                      |               |               | 2. The script part `Qualify *;` and `Unqualify;` are usually used when you want to fully qualify all field names in all subsequent tables loaded or joined in the script by prefixing each field name with the name of the table. In your case, it is not necessary as you are loading data from a single table source.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | - `sys.objects` contains one row for each user-defined, schema-scoped object that is created within a database.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | - The `type` field in `sys.objects` is a character string representing the type of the object, such as 'U' for a user table, 'V' for a view, 'P' for a stored procedure, 'FN' for a scalar function, 'IF' for an inline table-valued function, 'TF' for a table-valued function, 'FS' for a CLR scalar function, and 'FT' for a CLR table-valued function.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | 1. Last update of a database object: SQL Server does not track this by default. |      |                                      |               |               | 2. |      |                                      |               |               | The last update time of a table/view and row count can be obtained but they require different methodologies.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | This script now returns two result sets - one for the schema, object type and name, creation date, and row count, and the other for job names. Please be aware that the row count will only return for tables (where `o.type = 'U'`) as it doesn't make sense for procedures or views. Also, you'll need necessary permissions to access the MSDB database to retrieve job names.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | Lastly, keep in mind that there isn't an out-of-the-box, performant way to get the last update time for a table/view/procedure in SQL Server. This generally requires additional tracking on your side, e.g., using triggers to record last update times.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                       |                                      |

| 1372 | c2ff5699-6cb9-437c-9238-41e16990163f | assistant     |   1.68919e+09 | Unfortunately, SQL Server does not inherently track the information about who created or last updated a table, view, or stored procedure in its system views. |      |                                      |               |               | If you want to implement this sort of auditing in the future, you would have to create an auditing strategy that fits your needs. This might involve creating triggers on the tables you want to audit that fire when an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE operation occurs. These triggers could then insert a row into an audit table that includes the current user, the time of the operation, and the type of operation. For tracking object creation, you might need to create DDL triggers.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | Here's a rundown of what the columns represent:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | - `user_name`: The name of the user.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | - `creation_date`: The date and time the user was created.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | - `user_status`: Whether or not the user is active.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | - `roles`: The roles assigned to the user.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | Please note that this query only retrieves server-level principals and their roles, not database-level ones.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | Also note, detecting whether a user has a password is not possible directly from SQL Server, since passwords are not stored in plaintext for security reasons. However, you could potentially infer this: generally, SQL Server logins (as opposed to Windows logins) have a password, while Windows logins do not because they use the Windows account's password.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | Lastly, SQL Server does not track history about the user (e.g., what actions they performed, when they logged in/out, etc.) out of the box. You would need to set up some form of auditing to track this information. This could be using SQL Server's built-in SQL Server Audit feature, or potentially a third-party tool. If you need this information, I would recommend looking into these options.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | However, there are ways to track this information moving forward, but these require explicit setup and cannot retrieve historical data:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | 1. **DDL Triggers**: You can create a DDL trigger that fires whenever a `CREATE LOGIN`, `CREATE USER`, `ALTER LOGIN`, or `ALTER USER` statement is run. The trigger can write an entry to a custom audit table that records who ran the command and when.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | 2. **SQL Server Audit**: You can use SQL Server Audit to track and log specific events, like the creation of users or changes to logins.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | 3. **Server-side Trace or Extended Events Session**: These can capture and log events related to login and user management.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                       |                                      |
|      |                                      |               |               | Keep in mind, all these approaches only work for events that occur after they have been set up. They cannot retrieve information about who created existing users or logins. It's always a good idea to consider and implement such auditing measures in your database design if you foresee a need for this kind of information.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                       |                                      |

|      |                                      |               |               | This method works by reducing the data that is visible to the user. While it doesn't hide the sheets per se, the sheets will appear empty to users who don't have access to the data that the sheet is designed to display. You need to be careful with section access because if not properly implemented, you might accidentally deny access to all the users, including yourself.
